level.heading: Taking property without right.
level.text: A person commits the offense of taking property without right if that person takes and carries away the property of another without right to do so. A person convicted of taking property without right shall be fined not more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01 or imprisoned for not more than 90 days, or both.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-317 substituted "not more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01" for "not more than $300".

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 205(g) of the Criminal Fine Proportionality Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-45, April 1, 2013, 60 DCR 5400, 20 DCSTAT 1300).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 4-164
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 4-164, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 22-3201.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Applicability of D.C. Law 19-317: Section 401 of D.C. Law 19-317 provided that the act shall apply only to offenses committed on or after June 11, 2013.
